BasicDescription.Title: A Good Read
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Rosie Boycott presents the book review programme with guests Observer columnist and reviewer Sue Arnold and soprano Catherine Bott, widely known for her work in early vocal music.

BasicDescription.Title: File On 4
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Julian O'Halloran reports on major issues, changing attitudes and important events at home and abroad.

BasicDescription.Title: Analysis
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The European Juggernaut: Ideas for a European constitution will allow countries to leave the EU. Bruce Clark asks whether a Union that was losing members would survive.

The European Juggernaut
Soon the European Union will stretch from Galway to the Black Sea and have huge powers over 400 million people. But ideas for a European constitution include plans for countries to leave the EU, voluntarily or after being expelled.
Bruce Clark asks whether a Union that was losing members as well as gaining them could survive, and whether the European juggernaut can stay on the road.

BasicDescription.Title: A World In Your Ear
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Emily Buchanan presents highlights from English-language radio programmes from around the world. In this edition, how new talent finds its way onto the airwaves or fails to.

BasicDescription.Title: Word Of Mouth
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Winter Draws On: A look at the curious and sometimes confusing world of Homophones. Plus, premium parlance - the language they're using to part us from our cash this Christmas.

BasicDescription.Title: Money Box
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Paul Lewis brings you the latest news from the world of personal finance, and impartial money advice.

BasicDescription.Title: Midnight News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Telling Tales
BasicDescription.Synopsis: 8. Aunt Eveline: Written and read by Alan Bennett in ten parts. With customary wryness, Alan Bennett reminisces about growing up in Leeds. With music by George Fenton.

BasicDescription.Title: Shipping Forecast
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest Shipping Forecast.

BasicDescription.Title: As BBC World Service
BasicDescription.Synopsis: BBC Radio 4 joins the BBC World Service for a selection of news and current affairs, arts and science programmes. BBC Radio 4 resumes at 5.35am.

BasicDescription.Title: Radio 4 Open Up
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest Shipping Forecast, Coastal Reports and Inshore Waters forecast. Followed by Bells On Sunday, which comes from the church of St. Michaels, Cornhill, London

BasicDescription.Title: From Our Own Correspondent
BasicDescription.Synopsis: World Service comment and analysis from BBC correspondents worldwide.

BasicDescription.Title: News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Something Understood
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Another Brick In The Wall: Joan Bakewell explores the symbolism of the wall, a barrier which encloses, protects and segregates but sometimes crumbles and falls.

BasicDescription.Title: Living World
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Lionel Kelleway joins naturalist Roy Dennis in one of Scotland's few remaining areas of Caledonian pine forest. Centuries ago, the woods were home to wolves, lynx and wild cattle.

Caledonian Pine Forest
Lionel Kelleway joins naturalist Roy Dennis in one of the few remnants of ancient Caledonian pine forest in the Scottish highlands. Centuries ago, these eerie forests were home to wolves, lynx and wild cattle and they are still home to some unique Scottish wildlife.

BasicDescription.Title: News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Sunday Papers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A look at the morning papers.

BasicDescription.Title: Sunday
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Edward Stourton with the religious and ethical news of the week, moral arguments, and perspectives on stories familiar and unfamiliar.

BasicDescription.Title: The Radio 4 Christmas Appeal
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Reverend Nicholas Holtam, vicar of St Martin-In-The-Fields London, with the traditional Radio 4 Christmas Appeal on behalf of the church's social work. .

Reverend Nicholas Holtam, vicar of St Martin-In-The-Fields London, with the traditional Radio 4 Christmas Appeal on behalf of the church's social work in the capital and around the country.
Donations: St Martin-in-the-Fields Christmas Appeal, Trafalgar Square, London WC2N 4JJ or c/o www.stmartin-in-the-fields.org
Credit Cards: 0207 766 1125

BasicDescription.Title: News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4. Followed by a brief review of today's papers.

BasicDescription.Title: Sunday Worship
BasicDescription.Synopsis: For the second Sunday of Advent, led by the Reverend Johnston McKay from St Johns Renfield, Glasgow.

For the second Sunday of Advent, led by the Reverend Johnston McKayfrom St Johns Renfield, Glasgow.
The coming of Jesus as seen through the distinctive traditions of Scotland, with the Bearsden Choir, Avril McCusker (soprano) and Declan McCusker (tenor).
Director of Music: James Hunter Organist: John Langdon

BasicDescription.Title: Letter From America
BasicDescription.Synopsis: By Alistair Cooke. Insight, anecdote and history from the doyen of commentators.

BasicDescription.Title: Broadcasting House
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Eddie Mair presents a fresh and irreverent approach to the news, discussing the top stories of the week with his studio guests.

BasicDescription.Title: Received With Thanks
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The Story Behind The Radio 4 Christmas Appeal: Behind the scenes of the Radio 4 Christmas Appeal which each year raises money on behalf of St Martin in the Fields in London.

The Story Behind The Radio 4 Christmas Appeal
For over 75 years BBC Radio has broadcast a Christmas appeal. The money raised is used by St Martin-in-the-Fields to help the homeless in London and those in need across the country. In Received With Thanks, John Waite finds out how the money is spent. He meets those who benefit from the work of the Social Care Unit in Trafalgar Square and hears from some of the many thousands of people who are helped by grants made possible by the appeal.
Donations: St Martin-in-the-Fields Christmas Appeal, Trafalgar Square, London WC2N 4JJ or c/o www.stmartin-in-the-fields.org
Credit Cards: 0207 766 1125

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Catch up with the past week's events in Ambridge with the omnibus edition of the popular radio drama series.

BasicDescription.Title: Desert Island Discs
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sue Lawley's castaway this week is the crime writer Patricia Cornwell.

BasicDescription.Title: News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news headlines from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: I'm Sorry I Haven't A Clue
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The perennial antidote to panel games. Tony Hawks joins regulars Barry Cryer, Graeme Garden and Tim Brooke-Taylor, with chairman Humphrey Lyttelton and Colin Sell at the piano.

BasicDescription.Title: The Food Programme
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sheila Dillon looks at kitchen gadgets, from the most useful to the most spectacularly useless, and investigates the latest items of kitchen paraphernalia. .

Gadgets
This week, Sheila will discover which are the most useful and most useless kitchen gadgets ever invented and what bits of cookery kit are being dreamed up by the gadget maestros in their work shops in Northern Italy.
.

BasicDescription.Title: The World This Weekend
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Join James Cox with a look at events around the world.

BasicDescription.Title: Soldier, Soldier
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Drama documentary exploring the life of the British soldier. A Royal Welsh Fusilier writes to his Portuguese wife after a tough encounter with Napoleon's army at Albuera. With Iestyn Jones.

BasicDescription.Title: Gardeners' Question Time
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Eric Robson chairs the popular horticultural forum. Bob Flowerdew, Pippa Greenwood and Roy Lancaster answer questions sent in by post.

BasicDescription.Title: New Shoots, Old Tips
BasicDescription.Synopsis: 4. Good Husbandry Goeth Not All by Much Expense: Caroline Holmes scavenges thrifty tips from the past 2000 years on how to save money in your garden.

BasicDescription.Title: Classic Serial
BasicDescription.Synopsis: My Family And Other Animals: Janys Chambers's dramatisation of Gerald Durrell's classic comic tale about his eccentric family and his natural history escapades on Corfu in the 1930s.

By Gerald Durrell, dramatised by Janys Chambers.
My Family And Other Animals is Gerald Durrell's comic gem of a book, the classic story of his upper-class English eccentric family, whose antics persist on disrupting his enthralling natural history escapades on the sunny, pre-package holiday Greek island of 1930s Corfu.
Recounted with immense humour and charm, this is a wonderful account of a rare, magical childhood.
Episode 2: Gerry's animal collection increases to such an extent that the family's chaotic Christmas party gets totally out of hand.
Gerry ...... Adam Usden Adult Gerry ...... Will Tacey Mother ...... Celia Imrie Larry ...... Toby Jones Margo ...... Anna Kirke Leslie ...... Paul Hunter Spiro ...... Andreas Markos Dr Androuchelli/Michael/Kosti ...... Graeme Hawley
Directed in Manchester by Polly Thomas

BasicDescription.Title: Open Book
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Mariella Frostrup, with guests Terence Blacker and James Walton, looks at the hypes, flops and hits of the books of 2002 - including listeners' choices.

BasicDescription.Title: Adventures In Poetry
BasicDescription.Synopsis: 4. Snow, by Louis MacNeice: Peggy Reynolds explores the background, effect and lasting appeal of some well-loved poems.

BasicDescription.Title: Shipping Forecast
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest Shipping Forecast.

BasicDescription.Title: Six O'Clock News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Pick Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Nick Clarke presents his selection of highlights from the past week on BBC radio.

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Simon has some important news.

BasicDescription.Title: Go4It
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The children's magazine visits a sweet factory in Blackpool. Plus a look at some Greek myths in the British Museum with Diane Redmond.

If you've every wondered how sweets are made - fear not because on this week's Go4It we spend the day at a sweet factory in Blackpool following a day in the life of a Mint Humbug!
And we'll be travelling back in time at the British Museum, to look at some Greek Myths with the author Diane Redmond.

BasicDescription.Title: This Sceptred Isle
BasicDescription.Synopsis: 1995-96: Major Resigns And Labour Reforms: Anna Massey narrates the 20th-century section of Christopher Lee's history of Britain.

BasicDescription.Title: The Westminster Hour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Andrew Rawnsley with the week's political stories. Including at 10.45pm the documentary The Voice Of Destiny - Churchill's language.
